alert.note: Alert for City of Roanoke; City of Salem; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 2:44PM EDT until July 09 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...City of Roanoke and the City of Salem. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that between 1.0 and 1.5 inches of rain fell across the Salem and Roanoke City areas during the past 1 to 1.5 hours. While the rainfall has diminished, this rainfall combined with recent repeated rainfall events will result in quick runoff of additional rainfall. Overflowing poor drainage areas will result in minor flooding within the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Paint Bank Branch, Gum Spring Branch, Roanoke River, Mason Creek, Murray Run, Cook Creek, Carvin Creek, Back Creek, Gish Branch and Horners Branch. Additional rainfall amounts during the next hour or so are expected to be less than 1/2 inch. This will allow any high water issues to gradually recede. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Cave Spring... Hollins... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
